brief_summary.textblock:
Several studies have been conducted throughout the world to evaluate patients' and parents'
      preferences regarding physicians' attire.  Most studies have shown that the attire
      influences their feelings trust and confidence regarding their care.  In most countries the
      preference is for formal attire.  In other places a more casual attire is generally
      accepted.  Israel is a country where casual dress is acceptable in most settings.  Israeli
      physician's dress code has been discussed in the past, but  has never been systematically
      studied.  The aim of this study is to systematically examine the attitudes of parents of
      children who have been admitted to the pediatric ward towards physicians' attire.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preferences of Parents for Pediatric Inpatient Ward Physicians' Attire

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Parents whose children have been hospitalized

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  All others

study_pop.textblock: Parents whose children have been hospitalized

primary_outcome.description: Final analysis of survey will be processed and  the total number of parents preferring formal physician attire will be determined.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of parents preferring formal physician attire
